pull.title: p2p: Return a max of 1000 addrs from CAddrMan::GetAddr
pull.body:
This is the documented max size for an addr response, and was separately being
limited in PushAddress to 1000 via MAX_ADDR_TO_SEND. No point in selecting a
too-large random set then filtering it randomly down to a smaller set.

p2p: Return a max of 1000 addrs from CAddrMan::GetAddr

This is the documented max size for an addr response, and was separately being
limited in PushAddress to 1000 via MAX_ADDR_TO_SEND. No point in selecting a
too-large random set then filtering it randomly down to a smaller set.

events.message:
p2p: Return a max of 1000 addrs from CAddrMan::GetAddr

This is the documented max size for an addr response, and was separately being
limited in PushAddress to 1000 via MAX_ADDR_TO_SEND. No point in selecting a
too-large random set then filtering it randomly down to a smaller set.

events.body: I think addrman would return a larger list that is node-agnostic and then net would filter that list taking into account the node state, no?

<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->Note to reviewers: This pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* #14033 (p2p: Drop CADDR_TIME_VERSION checks now that MIN_PEER_PROTO_VERSION is greater by Empact)
* #13115 (addrman: Add Clang thread safety annotations for variables guarded by cs_addrMan by practicalswift)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

@MarcoFalke the only call to `GetAddr` / `GetAddr_` is in service of this `GETADDR` response:
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/95d731d9b38819cb822dbcd365972a14ae78d21f/src/net_processing.cpp#L2747-L2750

`PushAddress` just overwrites entry if it's beyond the limit:
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/95d731d9b38819cb822dbcd365972a14ae78d21f/src/net.h#L816-L828

issue.title: p2p: Drop CADDR_TIME_VERSION checks now that MIN_PEER_PROTO_VERSION is greater
issue.body:
As per @jnewbery's comment below, "After the version handshake, the version must be >= MIN_PEER_PROTO_VERSION, since we immediately disconnect any peer that advertises a lower version than that in its version message"
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14033#issuecomment-652456443

events.body: I thought the two layer setup was so that multiple probes would get more addresses but not enumerate the whole table.

@Empact `PushAddr` will return early when `addrKnown.contains` it. So when `vAddr` is of size 1000, it might very well send less than 1000 addresses back in the response, even though there are plenty to send. No?
@MarcoFalke yep that sounds like the explanation. Thanks!

verification.payload:
tree 169742684a22ef1c747513bc8405d9505df3fa72
parent e6d375b1c032e3f27352510fa52fdb297d33a353
author Ben Woosley <ben.woosley@gmail.com> 1536713109 -0400
committer Ben Woosley <ben.woosley@gmail.com> 1537137687 -0400

Don't return known addresses from CConnman::GetAddresses

These addresses are used expressly for sending to a node in response to
GETADDR, so we may as well skip them over in the lookup soas to return the
appropriate number.

events.message:
Don't return known addresses from CConnman::GetAddresses

These addresses are used expressly for sending to a node in response to
GETADDR, so we may as well skip them over in the lookup soas to return the
appropriate number.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -172,7 +172,7 @@ class CAddrInfo : public CAddress
 #define ADDRMAN_GETADDR_MAX_PCT 23
 
 //! the maximum number of nodes to return in a getaddr call
-#define ADDRMAN_GETADDR_MAX 2500
+#define ADDRMAN_GETADDR_MAX 1000
comments.body: When we're editing this file  what about skipping the use of the preprocessor and use proper constants instead? :-)

I like changing these to a constant, however "maximum number of addresses in GETADDR" is a P2P layer constant, I don't think it should use addrman's internal constant. `src/protocol.h` would be a better place.
